_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:03:41 using v2.1
title: How have the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services changed?
analysis_commentary:
Similar to the numbers of nurses in community services the number of nurses in psychiatric services also does not follow the same overall pattern for all qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff.

As previously mentioned the number of full time equivalent nurses in community psychiatry settings have remained static between September 2009 and October 2013, with only a 0.24% increase in numbers seen over the time period (data not shown).

In non-community psychiatry services the number of full time equivalent nurses in September 2009 was 26,299, which dropped to 23,051 in October 2013, a 12.4% decrease over four years.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
